<JD_START>
Job Title: User Experience Designer V

Location: San Francisco, CA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Art/Creative, Design, Information Technology

Description:
Responsibilities:

Be the UX design lead for projects across a range of platforms that touch numerous aspects of the company Music experience.Run the full experience design process (i.e., discovery, research, concept development, wireframes, high-fidelity mocks) with a particular focus on customer mindsets, flows, and journeysWork from high-level requirements and ask the right questions to gather all relevant information to guide design direction.Quickly iterate on multiple design explorations to arrive at a simple, but robust solutions, accounting for complex requirements.Validate designs through research and testing.Design for current experiences while also envisioning and creating new experiences for future features.Stay current on emerging UX and digital behavior trends, music and design innovations, and broader technological shifts, as well as identify opportunities to incorporate best current thinking into product designs.Collaborate on and present work to a range of stakeholders – executives, engineers, product managers, business leaders, researchers, other UX and visual designers.

Additional basic qualifications:

Bachelor's or Master's Degree in design (UX, product), HCI, behavioral economics, cognitive psychology, or related field or equivalent professional experience.5+ years of experience in UX design and research for products on web, mobile, voice or emerging platforms.Experience working in direct collaboration with product managers, front and back-end engineers, and business or editorial stakeholders.Strong online portfolio and results in digital (web and app, if not also emerging platform and voice) work.Proven ability to present a strategic rationale for design decisions to executive-level stakeholdersExperience demonstrating ownership of projects and communicating timelines, executing independentlyExperience designing with Pattern Libraries and using a variety of research and testing methodologies.Excellent communication, interpersonal, and analytical skills including the ability to present design concepts clearly and persuasively to colleagues, partners and stakeholdersAbility to work efficiently and demonstrate a bias for action in a fast-paced, sometimes ambiguous environmentRelentless desire for innovation, balanced with business needs and customer expectationsProficiency in UX design and prototyping tools

Preferred Qualifications:

Lead product designer for medium to large projects that present multidisciplinary challenges and span multiple platforms and departmentsExpertise in complex service design challengesExperienced in integrating qualitative and quantitative data into design work and iterations

Compensation:

The pay rate range above is the base hourly pay range that Aditi Consulting reasonably expects to pay someone for this position (compensation may vary outside of this range depending on a number of factors, including but not limited to, a candidate’s qualifications, skills, competencies, experience, location and end client requirements).

Benefits and Ancillaries:

Medical, dental, vision, PTO benefits and ancillaries may be available for eligible Aditi Consulting employees and vary based on the plan options selected by the employee.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
<JD_END>
